title: Slave trade Europe vs from Americas graph Q4

content.question: For the period circa 1775–1825, the opposite trends in the number of voyages originating in Europe and in the Americas would most likely support the claim that

choices.label: smuggling and piracy substantially disrupted the flow of slave ships in the Atlantic
the French Revolution prompted slaveholders in the United States to decrease their reliance on enslaved persons’ labor and import indentured servants from Asia instead
even though some countries moved to outlaw or limit the trans-Atlantic slave trade, demand for enslaved labor remained strong in places such as Brazil and Cuba
direct European control of Latin America was replaced by indirect imperialism by European and United States business interests

content.answer: even though some countries moved to outlaw or limit the trans-Atlantic slave trade, demand for enslaved labor remained strong in places such as Brazil and Cuba

topic.text: 6.6: Causes of Migration in an Interconnected World

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
